security: Revealing MORENO's association with individuals like Tad SZULC and Jorge VOLSKY, and the AMTRUNK operation, could expose sensitive operational details and potential security breaches. The document states, 'MORENO's indiscretions were a serious problem that limited his effectiveness as a direct participant in the AMTRUNK Operation by arousing the concern of other participants.' Furthermore, the memo's detailing of MORENO leaking operational details to people who helped spread the information more widely, exposes a vulnerability in the security of the operation.
summary: A memorandum regarding Nestor Antonio MORENO Lopez (AMICE-27), detailing his background, involvement in the anti-BATISTA movement, defection, and problematic role in the AMTRUNK Operation due to security concerns and indiscretions.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET memorandum, dated February 14, 1977, discusses Nestor Antonio MORENO Lopez (AMICE-27) and his involvement with the CIA. It details MORENO's background as a Cuban lawyer and his participation in the anti-BATISTA movement, leading to his defection in 1961. The memo focuses on MORENO's problematic involvement in the AMTRUNK Operation, where his indiscretions and contacts with Tad SZULC and Jorge VOLSKY, individuals distrusted by the Agency, compromised the operation's security. His loose talk and conflicting interests led to his termination from the operation and subsequent attempts to interfere, resulting in his firing from the Rebel Army Radio Program and termination by the Station in March 1964.
title: Nestor Antonio MORENO Lopez (AMICE-27) (201-312091)
